Package MatrixPackage

Class MatrixMap.NonSquareException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
MatrixPackage.MatrixMap.NonSquareException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Enclosing class:
MatrixMap<T>
static class MatrixMap.NonSquareException extends Exception
This a nested Exception class to aid error handling, used to check if a Matrix object represents a square matrix.

  • Constructor Details

    • NonSquareException

      public NonSquareException(Indexes indexes)
      Constructor for the NonSquareException.
      Parameters:
      indexes - the Indexes object which is used to determine of the Matrix object is a square matrix or not. This should be the size of a Matrix.

  • Method Details

    • getIndexes

      public Indexes getIndexes()
      Gets the Indexes used to determine if the Matrix is a square or not, as defined by the constructor.
      Returns:
      the Indexes object set upon instantiation.

    • requireDiagonal

      public static Indexes requireDiagonal(Indexes indexes)
      Checks if the index that is passed into the argument is on the diagonal of the matrix. In other words, this method checks if the row and column of the Indexes object are equal, which would indicate that the Matrix is indeed square. If not, this method throws an IllegalStateException with the cause, NonSquareException.
      Parameters:
      indexes - the Indexes object which should represent the size of the object.
      Returns:
      a new IllegalStateException if the Indexes object is not on the diagonal; the Indexes object otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException
